habtools 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Complexity metrics for DEMs
    • Complexity metrics for 3D meshes

    Fractal dimension

    fd.Rd

    Fractal dimension

    fd(data, method, x, y, L, lvec, ...)

    Arguments

    data

    Digital elevation model of class RasterLayer or a triangular mesh of class mesh3d.

    method

    If data is a RasterLayer, possible methods are:"hvar", "area", and "cubes" (defaults to "hvar"). If data is a mesh3d, possible methods are "cubes" and "area" (defaults to "cubes").

    x

    Bottom-left of bounding box. Only considered if data is a RasterLayer.

    y

    Bottom-left of bounding box. Only considered if data is a RasterLayer.

    L

    Bounding box extent (i.e., side length). Only considered if data is a RasterLayer.

    lvec

    scales to use for calculation

    ...

    Arguments from other fd_ functions.

    Value

    A value for fractal dimension, typically between 2 and 3.

    Details

    Calculates fractal dimension using the specified method. Note that methods are distinctly different and should not be mixed when comparing values for multiple objects. The cubes method is not recommended if the height range is much smaller than the extent of a 3d object or DEM, which is typically the case for DEMs.

    See also

    fd_hvar()

    fd_area()

    fd_cubes()

    Examples

    library(habtools)
fd(horseshoe, method = "hvar", x = -470, y = 1266, L = 2, lvec = c(0.125, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2))
#> [1] 2.150995
fd(horseshoe, method = "area", x = -470, y = 1266, L = 2, lvec = c(0.125, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2))
#> [1] 2.174148
fd(mcap, method = "cubes", lvec = c(0.045, 0.09, 0.18, 0.5), plot = TRUE)

#> [1] 2.158836
fd(mcap, method = "area", lvec = c(0.02, 0.04, 0.08, 0.16))
#> [1] 2.433661
